alert.note: Alert for Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Grand Valley; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 5:54PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds will impact portions of western Mesa County through 630 PM MDT... At 553 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles northwest of Fruita to 6 miles southwest of Grand Junction. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Grand Junction around 605 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Palisade. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 8 and 42. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 48. Colorado 139 between mile markers 1 and 12. Colorado 141 between mile markers 122 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Grand Valley; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide
